tuv.seg: Being asked to reduce your pay or your hours of work
Nuair a iarrtar ort d'uaireanta oibre a laghdú
• Reduction of working hours or pay
• Laghdú ar uaireanta oibre nó pá
• Lay off or short-time working
• Leagan as nó obair ghearr-ama
When your employer has a downturn in business or there is less work for you to do, your employer may ask you to take a pay cut or to work fewer hours
Nuair atá cor chun donais i gcúrsaí gnó ag fostóir nó má tá laghdú ar am méid oibre atá ar fáil duit, d'fhéadfadh fostóir iarraidh ort laghdú pá a thógáil nó níos lú uaireanta a oibriú
If your employer tells you that he or she is unable to continue employing you on your current terms and conditions of employment you need to consider your employer’s request very carefully

Má deir d’fhostóir leat nach bhfuil sé nó sí ábalta leanúint le do chuid fostaíochta de réir do théarmaí agus coinníollacha reatha, caithfidh tú iarratas an fhostóra a bhreithniú go cúramach chomh maith le do chás féin
You should ask your employer for details of the reduced business activity, who else has been asked to reduce their hours of work or pay and what were the criteria for selection
Ba chóir duit ceist a chur ar d’fhostóir maidir le sonraí na gníomhaíochta gnó laghdaithe, na daoine eile a iarratar orthu a gcuid uaireanta oibre a laghdú agus na critéir roghnaithe
Reduction of working hours or pay
Laghdú ar uaireanta oibre nó pá
If your employer asks you to work fewer hours or take a pay cut, this is a change to your contract of employment
Má iarrann fostóir ort níos lú uaireanta a oibriú nó laghdú pá a thógáil, seo athrú ar théarmaí agus choinníollacha do chonartha fostaíochta
Any change to your contract of employment must be agreed by both you and your employer
Caithfidh athrú ar bith ar do chonradh fostaíochta a bheith aontaithe idir tú féin agus an fostóir
When deciding whether or not to agree to working reduced hours or to a reduction in pay, there are a number of issues to be considered:
Nuair atá cinneadh á dhéanamh agat aontú nó easaontú leis na huaireanta nó pá laghdaithe, tá roinnt saincheisteanna le breithniú:
• Reduced pay – what are the implications of this – for example, money and tax and paying the rent or mortgage
• Laghdú pá - cad iad na himpleachtaí a bheidh i gceist - mar shampla, airgead agus cáin agus cíos nó morgáiste a íoc
• Scheduling of working hours – it may suit you and your family to reduce your hours, for example working a day less per week or 2 hours less each day
• Sceidealú uaireanta oibre - d'fhéadfadh laghdú uaireanta oiriúint duit féin nó do theaghlach, mar shampla lá níos lú a oibriú in aghaidh na seachtaine nó 2 uair níos lú gach lá
• Downturn in business – what choice do you have
• Cor chun donais i gcúrsaí gnó - cén rogha atá agat
If you don’t accept a reduction in your working hours or pay, your employer may decide to make you redundant
Mura nglacann tú le huaireanta oibre nó pá laghdaithe, b'fhéidir go gcinnfeadh d’fostóir tú a dhéanamh iomarcach
You should ask your employer to give you written details of this proposed change to your contract of employment including a review date
Ba chóir duit ceist a chur ar d’fhostóír chun sonraí scríofa den athrú molta ar do chonartha fostaíochta, dáta athbhreithniúcháin san áireamh
You should respond to this in writing and if you are proposing to accept the change, you should stress that your acceptance is temporary
Ba chóir duit freagra scríofa a thabhairt agus, má molann tú leis an athrú a glacadh, caithfidh tú cur i bhfios go láidir go mbeadh do ghlacadh sealadach
At the review date the change to your contract can be reconsidered and you could ask to return to the original terms and conditions of your contract
Nuair a mbeadh an athrú ar do chonartha fostaíochta athbhreithnithe ag an dáta sin, is féidir iarratas a dhéanamh chun fill ar do bunthéarmaí agus coinníollacha
Minimum wage: In some cases an employment contract or terms of employment will say that an employee is paid at the "prevailing National Minimum Wage hourly rate"
Íosráta pá: I roinnt cásanna leagann conradh fostaíochta nó téarmaí fostaíochta go n-íoctar fostaí "ag Íosráta Pá Náisiúnta san am"
Where this is the case, an employer may reduce the employee's pay in line with the minimum wage rates
Sa chás seo, is féidir fostóir pá an fhostaí a laghdú de réir íosrátaí pá náisiúnta
In other cases there may be a provision in the contract that provides for a reduction in pay
I gcásanna eile d'fhéadfadh foráil sa chonradh a bheith ann a gceadaíonn laghdú pá
Where this is not the case, your employer cannot reduce it without your agreement, as this would change the terms of your contract of employment
Murar é sin an cás, ní féidir le d'fhostóir é a laghdú gan do chomhaontú mar athróidh sé na téarmaí do chonradh fostaíochta
Again, you may agree to reduced wages, if, for example, the alternative may be reduced hours or redundancy in the current economic situation
Áfach, b'fhéidir go n-aontaíonn tú le pá laghdaithe, má tá an rogha uaireanta laghdaithe nó iomarcaíocht sa staid eacnamaíoch reatha, mar shampla
If you do not agree to reduced working hours or pay
Mura n-aontaíonn tú le huaireanta oibre nó pá laghdaithe
If your employer proposes to reduce your working hours or pay, this is a change to your terms and conditions of employment
Má bheartaíonn fostóir do chuid uaireanta oibre nó pá a laghdú, seo athrú ar do théarmaí agus coinníollacha fostaíochta
You may agree to the reduction for reasons as described above
D'fhéadfá aontú leis an laghdú ar na cúiseanna thíosluaite
If you do not agree to this reduction there are a number of options available to you:
Mura n-aontaíonn tú leis an laghdú tá roinnt roghanna agat:
• You may make a complaint to the Workplace Relations Commission under the Industrial Relations Acts 1969-2015
• Is féidir leat gearán a dhéanamh leis an gCoimisiún um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre faoi na hAchtanna um Chaidreamh Tionscail, 1969-2015
Under this legislation, if your employer objects to a hearing by a Workplace Relations Commission adjudicator, you would have to refer the matter to the Labour Court
De réir na reachtaíochta seo mura n-aontaíonn d'fhostóir le héisteacht breithneora an Choimisiúin um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre, caithfidh tú cur an t-ábhar chun an Chúirt Oibreachais
• If you say you wish to continue working as before your employer may decide to make you redundant
• Más mian leat leanúint ag obair mar roimhe sinb'fhéidir go gcinnfeadh d’fostóir tú a dhéanamh iomarcach
If you are dismissed in this way, you may qualify to bring a claim for unfair dismissal
Má tá tú dífhostaithe ó do chuid fostaíochta, d'fhéadfá bheith incháilithe chun éileamh ar dhífhostú éagórach a dhéanamh
Unless your employer can prove there was a genuine redundancy situation and that fair procedures were followed, this dismissal may be found to be unfair
Ceaptar go bhfuil dífhostú éagórach murar féidir le d’fhostóir cúis iomarcaíochta dhílis agus nósanna imeachta maithe a thabhairt leis

• If your employer insists on reducing your working hours or pay you may also consider that you have no choice but to resign and claim constructive dismissal because your employer has breached the terms of your contract

• Má d’áitíonn d'fhostóir uaireanta oibre nó pá a laghdú b'fhéidir nach bhfuil rogha agat ach éirí as agus éileamh a dhéanamh ar dífhostú inchiallaithe toisc go bhfuil téarmaí an chonartha sáraithe ag an bhfostóir
Before you do this, you should always seek detailed legal advice as proving constructive dismissal can often be difficult
Roimh a leithéidí a dhéanamh, ba chóir duit comhairle dlí mhionsonraithe a lorg i gcónaí mar bíonn sé deacair dífhostú inchiallaithe a chruthú go minic
• If you think that a reduction in your pay or your working hours is a breach of your employment contract you could seek redress through the civil courts
• Má cheapann tú gur laghdú do phá nó d'uaireanta oibre sárú do chonartha fostaíochta é, is féidir leat sásamh a chuardach sna cúirteanna sibhialta
Lay off or short-time working
Leagan as nó obair ghearr-ama
Alternatively your employer may lay you off or put you on short time for a number of weeks
Nó féadfaidh an fostóir tú a leagan as nó a chur ar obair ghearr-ama ar feadh roinnt seachtainí
A lay-off situation arises where your employer is temporarily unable to provide work for you
Tarlaíonn leagan as nuair nach bhfuil fostóir ábalta go sealadach obair a sholáthar duit
A short-time situation arises where, due to a reduction in the amount of work to be done, your pay or hours are less than half the normal weekly amount
Tarlaíonn obair ghearr-ama nuair a bhíonn do phá nó uaireanta níos lú ná leath an gnáthmhéid sheachtainiúil - toisc laghdú ar an méid oibre atá le déanamh
In both cases these must be temporary situations and your employer must notify you before they start. The best way to do this is by using Part A of form RP9 (pdf)
Is cásanna sealadacha gur chóir a bheith i gceist sa dhá chás, agus ba chóir don fhostóir fógra a thabhairt duit roimh an dáta tosaithe ar fhoirm RP9 (pdf)
Your employer can lay you off or put you on short time if it is in your contract of employment or it is custom and practice in your workplace
Is féidir le fostóir tú a leagan as nó a chur ar ghearr-am má tá a leithéidí sonraithe i do chonradh fostaíochta nó más nósmhaireacht agus cleachtas atá san ionad oibre
Otherwise your employer should not lay you off or put you on short time without your agreement
Seachas sin, níor chóir don fhostóir tú a leagan as nó a chur ar ghearr-am gan chomhaontú uait
However if you do not agree you may be made redundant
Mar sin féin, d'fhéadfaí tú a dhéanamh iomarcach mura n-aontaíonn tú lena leithéidí
Claiming redundancy: If a lay-off or a short-time situation has continued for 4 weeks or more, or for 6 weeks in the last 13 weeks, you may claim a redundancy lump sum
Iomarcaíocht a éileamh: Má leanann cás leagain as nó gearr-ama ar feadh 4 seachtaine nó níos mó, nó ar feadh 6 seachtaine den 13 seachtain dheiridh, is féidir leat íocaíocht iomarcaíochta a éileamh
If you claim redundancy in this way you are considered to have left your job voluntarily and therefore you will lose any right to notice or pay in lieu of notice from your employer
Má dhéanann tú iomarcaíocht a éileamh ar an mbealach seo, breithneofar gur fhág tú do phost go deonach agus caillfear aon cheart atá agat ar fhógra nó ar phá in áit fógra fostóra dá réir
However if you have been laid off and you are subsequently made redundant by your employer you do not lose your notice entitlements
Mar sin féin, má dhéantar tú a leagan as agus go ndéanann fostóir iomarcach tú ina dhiaidh sin, ní chaillfear do theidlíochtaí fógra
Duration of lay off or short time: If you do not wish to claim redundancy but the lay-off or short-time situation continues, the question arises as to whether it is a temporary situation
Fad an leagain as nó gearr-ama: Murar mian leat iomarcaíocht a éileamh ach go leanann an cás leagain as nó gearr-ama, tagann ceist aníos an cás sealadach atá i gceist ar chor ar bith
If it becomes apparent that it is no longer temporary then the situation is now a redundancy rather than a lay-off or short-time working
Más léir nach cás sealadach atá i gceist níos mó, is iomarcaíocht atá i gceist leis an gcás seachas leagan as nó obair ghearr-ama
It is the employer who initially decides whether or not there is a redundancy situation
Is é/í an fostóir a chinneann i dtosach cibé an bhfuil nó nach bhfuil cás iomarcaíochta i gceist
If there is a dispute about this it should be referred to the Workplace Relations Commission to make a decision
Má tá díospóid faoina leithéidí, ba chóir an cheist a atreorú chuig an gCoimisiún um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre chun cinneadh a dhéanamh
If your hours of work are reduced so that you are unemployed for at least 4 out of 7 consecutive days you may be entitled to a social welfare jobseeker’s payment
Má tá do uaireanta oibre laghdaithe agus a bhíonn tú dífhostaithe ar a laghad 4 lá de thréimhse 7 lá leanúnach, d'fhéadfá a bheith i dteideal íocaíocht cuardaitheora poist a fháil
To qualify for Jobseeker’s Benefit you must have enough PRSI contributions and must have suffered a substantial loss of employment in any period of 7 consecutive days
Caithfidh tú dóthain ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC a bheith agat agus do fhostaíocht a bheith caillte agat in aon tréimhse 7 lá leanúnach chun bheith cáilithe Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist a fháil
This means, you must have lost at least one day's employment and as a result of this loss be unemployed for at least 4 days out of 7 days
Ciallaionn sé go caithfidh tú aon lá fostaíochta amháin a bheith caillte agat agus de bhrí sin a bheith as obair ar feadh 4 lá ar a laghad as 7 lá
Your earnings must also have been reduced because of the loss of employment
Caithfidh do phá a bheith laghdaithe mar gheall an fhostaíocht caillte
If your employer reduces your days at work to 3 days a week or less and you do not qualify for Jobseeker’s Benefit you may get Jobseeker's Allowance for the other days

Má laghdaíonn d’fhostóir do laethanta oibre go 3 lá sa seachtain nó níos lú agus mura gcáilíonn tú do Shocar Cuardaitheora Point, d'fhéadfá a bheith incháilithe do Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist a fháil do na laethanta eile
You must meet the other conditions that apply to Jobseeker's Allowance, for example, you must satisfy a means test
Caithfidh tú na coinníollacha eile maidir le Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist a chomhlánú , mar shampla, caithfidh tú tástáil mhaoine a shásamh
It may be possible to get Family Income Supplement if you have a family and your pay or hours are reduced
Má tá d’ioncam oibre laghdaithe agus leanbh amháin ar a laghad á thacú agat, d’fhéadfá Forlíonadh Ioncaim Teaghlaigh (FIT) a fháil
If you were made redundant within one year of being put on reduced hours or pay, your redundancy payment would be based on your earnings for a full week
Má rinneadh tú iomarcach laistigh de bhliain amháin ón am a cuireadh ar uaireanta nó pá laghdaithe tú, bheadh d’íocaíocht iomarcaíochta bunaithe ar do thuilleamh do sheachtain iomlán
If you are made redundant after working reduced hours for more than a year, how your payment will be calculated depends on whether you accepted being on reduced hours or not

Má dhéantar iomarcach tú tar éis duit uaireanta laghdaithe a oibriú do thréimhse níos mó ná bliain amháin, beidh an dóigh a dhéantar d’íocaíocht a ríomh ag brath ar cé acu ar ghlac tú nó nár ghlac tú le huaireanta laghdaithe

If you fully accepted the reduced working hours as your normal week and never asked to return to full-time work, then your redundancy payment will be based on your gross pay for the reduced working hours

Más rud é gur ghlac tú go hiomlán le huaireanta oibre laghdaithe mar do sheachtain normálta agus níor iarr tú filleadh go hobair lánaimseartha, mar sin beidh d’íocaíocht bunaithe ar do phá comhlán le haghaidh na n-uaireanta laghdaithe

If, on the other hand, you never accepted the reduced working hours as your normal hours and continually asked to be put back on full-time working, your payment would be based on your normal weekly earnings

Más rud é, ar an taobh eile de, nár ghlac tú riamh leis na huaireanta oibre laghdaithe mar chuid de d’uaireanta normálta agus gur iarr tú ar bhonn leanúnach le bheith curtha ar ais ar obair lánaimseartha, beidh d’íocaíocht bunaithe ar do thuilleamh do sheachtain iomlán
If you have a dispute about this with your employer you could make a claim to the Workplace Relations Commission
Má bhíonn conspóid agat le d’fhostóir faoi seo is féidir leat éileamh a dhéanamh leis an gCoimisiún um
Instead of reducing your working hours your employer may make you redundant and offer you alternative work under a new contract of employment
Seachas do chuid uaireanta a laghdú, caithfidh an fostóir tú a dhéanamh iomarcach agus obair mhalartach a thairiscint duit faoi chonradh fostaíochta nua
However this may affect your entitlement to a redundancy payment
Mar sin féin, d'fhéadfadh a leithéidí tionchar a bheith aige ar do theidlíocht ar íocaíocht iomarcaíochta
If your employer makes you a reasonable offer of alternative work, and you refuse it, you may lose your entitlement to a redundancy payment
Má dhéanann fostóir tairiscint réasúnta duit ar obair mhalartach, agus má dhiúltaíonn tú, d'fhéadfá do theidlíocht aríocaíocht iomarcaíochta a chailliúint
Generally speaking, alternatives which involve a loss of status or worsening of the terms and conditions of your employment would not be considered reasonable
Go ginearálta, ní mheastar go bhfuil obair mhalartach réasúnta más cailliúint stádais nó téarmaí agus coinníollacha fostaíochta níos measa atá i gceist duit
You may take up an alternative on a trial basis for up to 4 weeks
Is féidir leat obair mhalartach a thosú ar bhonn trialach ar feadh tréimhse suas le 4 seachtaine
Where the alternative involves a reduction of 50% or more in hours or pay, working under the new arrangements for up to 52 weeks will not count as an acceptance
Nuair a bhaineann laghdú 50% nó níos mó ar uaireanta oibre nó pá le hobair mhalartach, ní áireofar obair faoi shocruithe nua suas le 52 seachtain mar ghlacacht

If you accept an offer in writing from your employer for a new and different contract which will take effect within 4 weeks of the ending of the previous contract, you will not be entitled to claim redundancy

Má ghlacann tú le tairiscint i scríbhinn ón bhfostóir ar chonradh nua agus difriúil, a thiocfaidh i bhfeidhm laistigh de 4 sheachtain ó dheireadh an chonartha roimhe sin, ní bheidh tú i dteideal iomarcaíocht a éileamh
Equally, if you refuse such an offer unreasonably, you will lose your right to a redundancy payment
Ar an mbealach céanna, má dhiúltaíonn tú tairiscint go míréasúnta, caillfidh tú do cheart ar íocaíocht iomarcaíochta
Contact the Workplace Relations Commission's Information and Customer Service for information about your employment rights
Is féidir teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an tSeirbhís Fhaisnéise agus Custaiméara an Choimisiúin um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre chun eolas a fháil faoi chearta fostaíochta

Contact your local Citizens Information Centre for information about your rights and entitlements. Workplace Relations Commission Information and Customer Service O'Brien Road Carlow R93 W7W2 Ireland Opening Hours: Mon. to Fri
Is féidir leat teagmháil a dhéanamh le do Lárionad Faisnéise do Shaoránaigh áitiúil chun eolas a fháil faoi do chearta agus teidlíochtaí
